This is a wonderful book full of adapted nursery rhymes, and really makes them more interesting and fun than a lot of the old ones, as the older ones are often obscure and irrelevant, these rhymes are more present and easy to relate to. This book is just what the modern world of children's books needed. And it should be in classrooms everywhere. I think it's just wonderful. Highly educational, and a lot of fun too. My favourite one is This Little Piggy, but there are many favourites such as Baa Baa Black Sheep, and Old MacDonald. The good thing about these rhymes is that they show children more about the lives animals lead. Old MacDonald is another interesting one, because it explores all the different things that farmers grow in fields, so it is more educational than the original. Very good.

description: Vegan Nursery Rhymes contains adaptations of six well-known, popular children's rhymes with bright, colourful illustrations; re-worded to reflect compassion and respect for animals and the environment. Both light-hearted and thought-provoking, these rhymes can be sung to the tunes you know so well.NB This book is no longer in print but the nursery rhymes are included in the book "Why are you a vegan?" and other wacky verse for kids by Violet's Vegan Comics.
title: Vegan Nursery Rhymes: Vegan Adaptations of Six Popular Nursery Rhymes
